verses.verse: (Lam. 4:6; Dan. 9:12; (Amos 3:2); Matt. 24:21) And I will do among you what I have never done, and the like of which I will never do again, because of all your abominations.

Therefore fathers (Lev. 26:29; Deut. 28:53; 2 Kin. 6:29; Jer. 19:9; Lam. 2:20; 4:10) shall eat their sons in your midst, and sons shall eat their fathers; and I will execute judgments among you, and all of you who remain I will (Lev. 26:33; Deut. 28:64; Ps. 44:11; Ezek. 5:2, 12; 6:8; 12:14; Amos 9:9; Zech. 2:6; 7:14) scatter to all the winds.

‘Therefore, as I live,’ says the Lord GOD, ‘surely, because you have (2 Chr. 36:14; (Jer. 7:9-11); Ezek. 8:5, 6, 16) defiled My sanctuary with all your (Ezek. 11:21) detestable things and with all your abominations, therefore I will also diminish you; (Ezek. 7:4, 9; 8:18; 9:10) My eye will not spare, nor will I have any pity.

(Jer. 15:2; 21:9; Ezek. 6:12) One-third of you shall die of the pestilence, and be consumed with famine in your midst; and one-third shall fall by the sword all around you; and (Jer. 9:16; (Ezek. 6:8)) I will scatter another third to all the winds, and I will draw out a sword after (Jer. 43:10, 11; 44:27; Ezek. 5:2; 12:14) them.

‘Thus shall My anger (Lam. 4:11; Ezek. 6:12; 7:8) be spent, and I will (Ezek. 21:17) cause My fury to rest upon them, ((Deut. 32:36); Is. 1:24) and I will be avenged; (Is. 59:17; Ezek. 36:6; 38:19) and they shall know that I, the LORD, have spoken it in My zeal, when I have spent My fury upon them.
Moreover (Lev. 26:31; Neh. 2:17) I will make you a waste and a reproach among the nations that are all around you, in the sight of all who pass by.

‘So it shall be a (Deut. 28:37; 1 Kin. 9:7; Ps. 79:4; Jer. 24:9; Lam. 2:15) reproach, a taunt, a ((Is. 26:9); Jer. 22:8, 9; 1 Cor. 10:11) lesson, and an astonishment to the nations that are all around you, when I execute judgments among you in anger and in fury and in (Is. 66:15, 16; Ezek. 5:8; 25:17) furious rebukes. I, the LORD, have spoken.

When I (Deut. 32:23) send against them the terrible arrows of famine which shall be for destruction, which I will send to destroy you, I will increase the famine upon you and cut off your (Lev. 26:26; Ezek. 4:16; 14:13) supply of bread.

So I will send against you famine and (Lev. 26:22; Deut. 32:24; Ezek. 14:21; 33:27; 34:25; Rev. 6:8) wild beasts, and they will bereave you. (Ezek. 38:22) Pestilence and blood shall pass through you, and I will bring the sword against you. I, the LORD, have spoken.’ ”
Judgment on Idolatrous Israel Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying:
“Son of man, (Ezek. 20:46; 21:2; 25:2) set your face toward the (Ezek. 36:1) mountains of Israel, and prophesy against them,

and say, ‘O mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord GOD! Thus says the Lord GOD to the mountains, to the hills, to the ravines, and to the valleys: “Indeed I, even I, will bring a sword against you, and (Lev. 26:30) I will destroy your high places.
Then your altars shall be desolate, your incense altars shall be broken, and (Lev. 26:30) I will cast down your slain men before your idols.
And I will lay the corpses of the children of Israel before their idols, and I will scatter your bones all around your altars.
